name: Rules of procedure; costs; appeal
text:
The supreme court may prescribe rules of procedure relating to the appeals and hearings before the district courts.  An appeal shall lie from the judgment or order of the district court to the intermediate appellate court, subject to chapter 602.  The rules shall provide for informal procedure and for minimizing expense and delay to litigants therein.  The costs upon such appeal to the district court shall be $1, which may be waived by the court for good cause shown.  No costs shall be chargeable against the county director of finance. [L 1951, c 237, §3; RL 1955, §160-18; HRS ; am L 1973, c 135, §1; am L 2004, c 202, §36]
 
Note
 
  L 2004, c 202, §82 provides:
  "SECTION 82.  Appeals pending in the supreme court as of the effective date of this Act [July 1, 2006] may be transferred to the intermediate appellate court or retained at the supreme court as the chief justice, in the chief justice's sole discretion, directs."
 
Revision Note
 
  "Director of finance" substituted for "treasurer" to conform to county charters.
 
Rules of Court
 
  Appeal, see Hawaii Rules of Appellate Procedure.
